trans-unit.source: Represents a selectable <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> that can contain text and images.
Use ToolStripButton to create a toolbar button that supports both text and images.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ImageAlign%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.TextAlign%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties to get or set the positioning of ToolStripButton images and text.
You can display a ToolStripButton with various border styles, and you can use it to represent and activate operational states.
You can also define it to have the focus by default.

Although ToolStripButton replaces and extends the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> control of previous versions, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class that displays the specified image.
Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> that displays only an image on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton>.
The image to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class that displays the specified text.
Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> that displays only text on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton>.
The text to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class that displays the specified text and image.
Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> that displays both an image and text.
The text to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
The image to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class that displays the specified text and image and that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click"></xref> event.
Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> that displays both an image and text and raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click> event when clicked.
The text to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
The image to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
An event handler that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click"></xref> event.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> class with the specified name that displays the specified text and image and that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click"></xref> event.

Use this constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton> with the specified name that displays both an image and text and raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click> event when clicked.
The text to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
The image to display on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
An event handler that raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click"></xref> event.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether default or custom <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> text is displayed on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
Set the AutoToolTip property to `false` to display custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ToolTipText%2A> on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if default <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> text is displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> can be selected.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> can be selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> is pressed or not pressed.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> is pressed in or not pressed in; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.Checked*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> should automatically appear pressed in and not pressed in when clicked.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> should automatically appear pressed in and not pressed in when clicked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> is in the pressed or not pressed state by default, or is in an indeterminate state.
Set the CheckState to `Indeterminate` when you do not want to set a default state.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckState"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Unchecked" name="Unchecked" href=""></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckState"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.CheckState*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
If you do not explicitly call CreateAccessibilityInstance, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.
> [!NOTE] > To get or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.AccessibilityObject%2A> property, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether to display the ToolTip that is defined as the default.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref> can be fitted.
The specified area for a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton"></xref>.
An ordered pair of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> representing the width and height of a rectangle.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.CheckedChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnCheckedChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.CheckStateChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnCheckStateChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnPaint method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
